definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: He looked around and saw the bird standing on a stump and crying.
sentences.chinese: 他四下看了看，看见啄木鸟正站在一个树桩上哭呢。

sentences.english: Even so, a recession is under way.
sentences.chinese: 即使这样，衰退正四下肆虐。

sentences.english: Four-four was Madame de Genlis's signal.
sentences.chinese: 四下接四下是让利斯夫人的呼号。

sentences.english: Four-four was Madame de Genlis's signal.
sentences.chinese: 四下接四下是让利斯夫人的呼号。

sentences.english: He seized a stick and laid to in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起一根棍棒向四下乱打。

sentences.english: He could hear two men walking around the Upper Library, dusting the bookshelves with fly- whisks .
sentences.chinese: 只听得两个人走进书房，挥拂尘四下里拂拭。

sentences.english: I stepped into the bedroom and looked around, but there seemed to be nothing out of the ordinary.
sentences.chinese: 我走进卧室，朝四下里张望，没看见有什么异常。

sentences.english: Do you hear the gong striking four?
sentences.chinese: 你听见钟已打四下了么？

sentences.english: He looked around and spotted Garfield the Dwarf.
sentences.chinese: 他四下看了看，认出了矮子加菲尔德。

sentences.english: I should scarcely have known you: you look like a lady now.
sentences.chinese: 然后她就四下里望着想找希刺克厉夫。

sentences.english: It was deathly silent in the little temple, which was apparently uninhabited except for this one old monk.
sentences.chinese: 四下里万籁无声，这小庙中似乎就只这个老僧。

sentences.english: He looked around and found a tall tower in the south.
sentences.chinese: 他四下看了看，发现南边有一座高高的塔楼。

sentences.english: As you look around your room or entire house for that matter it seems impossible.
sentences.chinese: 你四下打量你的房间或是整个屋子，看来无从下手。

sentences.english: She looked desperately around for a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她在四下里找，急于弄到一件武器。

sentences.english: A few, however, look both ways and stuff a pamphlet in their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 不过，也有少数人四下看看，将小册子装进口袋。

definition: to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
to take a furtive look at
